articles.title: The Final Days of the Trump White House: Chaos and Scattered Papers
articles.description: Government documents that Mr. Trump had accumulated were with him in roughly two dozen boxes in the White House residence. They were to go to the National Archives, but at least some ended up in Florida.

articles.author: Ann M. Simmons in Moscow and Isabel Coles in Dnipro, Ukraine
articles.title: Drone Hits Headquarters of Russia’s Black Sea Fleet in Crimea
articles.description: The incident highlights Russia’s vulnerability in an area that has served as a stronghold for its occupation of Ukraine’s south coast.
articles.content:
A drone hit the headquarters of Russias Black Sea Fleet in Crimea on Saturday, reaching the heart of a heavily fortified naval base that has long allowed Moscow to project power in the region.

articles.title: At least 12 killed as Somalia hotel siege enters second day
articles.description: At least 12 people were killed when al Qaeda-linked militants attacked a hotel in Somalia's capital Mogadishu, seizing hostages who authorities were still battling to free 24 hours later, an intelligence officer said on Saturday.

articles.title: Finland prime minister takes drug test as populace ponders whether she has a right to party
articles.description: Finland prime minister Sanna Marin says she has taken a drug test 'for her own legal protection' after a video was leaked of her dancing at a party.

articles.title: Hot and humid; Timing on rounds of rain rolling in
articles.description: Rain chances return this weekend. We’re tracking a few rounds of storms Saturday and Sunday, even into Monday.
